issue.title: <frame/>: Support multiple frames in a single parent? Intended scope of frames? Use link names as frames?

content.raw:
8) Looking forward to it!

9) Per your above example, I definitely agree that *model* poses should not be able to have a frame specified (or it should only be `world`), and there should be no interdependency between the model frame and its child elements frames.

I do find value in being able to specify the `world` frame explicitly in `//model//frame` elements; if we want the parent frame to be the model frame, then we can do that on purpose.

I'm not sure I see the harm in preventing a model and its children from specifying `world` explicitly. At present, you can define joints that weld items to the `world`, so I would see it as kind of similar? Plus, enforcing this may make the parsing the frames a tad more complex than it may already be?

8) Looking forward to it!

9) Per your above example, I definitely agree that model poses should not be able to have a frame specified (or it should only be world), and there should be no interdependency between the model frame and its child elements frames.

I do find value in being able to specify the world frame explicitly in //model//frame elements; if we want the parent frame to be the model frame, then we can do that on purpose.

I'm not sure I see the harm in preventing a model and its children from specifying world explicitly. At present, you can define joints that weld items to the world, so I would see it as kind of similar? Plus, enforcing this may make the parsing the frames a tad more complex than it may already be?
